top_categories.workout_context: At mile 60 of 100, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Race-pace efforts that mimic The Mid South's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before March.
6,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
The Mid South's Oklahoma red clay roads, rolling hills forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 100 miles.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 100 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
60ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
100 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on rolling red clay gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At The Mid South, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of The Mid South. Train it until it feels boring.
At The Mid South, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 6,000ft of climbing on rolling red clay gravel does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.heat: March in Stillwater, Oklahoma — Early March brings 40-75°F swings, potential freezing rain, potential heat, potential wildfires. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before The Mid South — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for The Mid South’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at The Mid South requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on rolling red clay gravel to build confidence. Expect: oklahoma red clay roads, rolling hills, exposed ridgelines.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 100 miles of rolling red clay gravel in Stillwater, Oklahoma.
